meanings.definition: A small, rounded protuberance or lump.
meanings.sent1: The knub on the tree branch was smooth to touch.
meanings.sent2: She found a knub of clay in the art class.
meanings.sent3: The knub on the pencil made it hard to write properly.
meanings.sent4: The knub of ice on the windshield refused to melt.
meanings.sent5: The knub on the door handle helped in opening the door easily.

meanings.definition: To form into a small, rounded protuberance or lump.
meanings.sent1: He tried to knub the clay into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent2: She knubbed the dough before baking it.
meanings.sent3: The child attempted to knub the playdough into a heart shape.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor knubbed the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully knubbed the details on the sculpture.
